body:
# srcr

`srcr` is a full-scale API wrapper for the [speedrun.com](https://www.speedrun.com) [API](https://github.com/speedruncomorg/api) written in [Crystal](https://crystal-lang.org/). The goal of this implementation is to provide as much data as possible / reasonable. As such, this library makes use of [embedding](https://github.com/speedruncomorg/api/blob/master/version1/embedding.md) wherever possible. Where something cannot be embedded for some reason, the library provides shorthand methods to request the data.

## Installation

1. Add the dependency to your `shard.yml`:

```yaml
dependencies:
    srcr:
        github: shardlab/srcr
```

2. Run `shards install`

## Usage

This library is an almost one to one representation of how the API itself is laid out. The different endpoints are all accessible through `Srcom::Api::<Endpoint>`, essentially mapping one class to one of the [documentation files](https://github.com/speedruncomorg/api/tree/master/version1).

### Finding Games

As an example, to find Super Mario 64 we would use the `Srcom::Api::Games` class:

```crystal
require "srcr"

games = Srcom::Api::Games.find_by(name: "Super Mario 64") #=> Array(Game)

# or

games = Srcom::Api::Games.find_by(abbreviation: "sm64") #=> Array(Game)

# or

game = Srcom::Api::Games.find_by_id("sm64") #=> Game

# or

game = Srcom::Api::Games.find_by_id("o1y9wo6q") #=> Game
```

### IDs and Abbreviations

As seen in the above example, we could use the `Srcom::Api::Games.find_by_id` method to find Super Mario 64 both by its abbreviation ("sm64") and its ID ("o1y9wo6q"). Some endpoints that ask for an ID also accept an abbreviation (the parameter will be named `id` nonetheless though!), which will then redirect to the URL with the proper ID (don't worry, srcr handles that automatically). Not all endpoints that take an ID also take an abbreviation. If they do, it will be explicitely documented.
Try to avoid actually making use of this though, as the redirect will count towards your [rate limit](#rate-limits).

### Pagination

A lot of the resources available through the API are [paginated](https://github.com/speedruncomorg/api/blob/master/version1/pagination.md) with a maximum amount of 200 elements per page (except bulk game requests, which are capped at 1000 elements per page). For all of those endpoints srcr gives you full control but tries to set sensible defaults.
Let's try to do look for newly submitted runs as an example:

```crystal
require "srcr"

# This gets the 20 most recently submitted runs
runs = Srcom::Api::Runs.find_by(status: "new", order_by: "verify-date", sort_direction: "desc") #=> Array(Run)

# If we want to get all currently unverified runs we have to tell the method to do so
runs = Srcom::Api::Runs.find_by(status: "new", all_pages: true, max_results_per_page: 200) #=> Array(Run)
```

Do note that trying to get a lot of very large objects at once (namely `Run`s and especially `Game`s) can lead to the request timing out or speedrun.com throwing a 503 error. Usually `Run`s work out, but even if it goes at the expense of having to do more request try setting lower values for `max_results_per_page`.
Whenever you make a paginated request expect it to take a very long time, especially if that request wasn't made recently and speedrun.com doesn't have it cached. For reference, trying to get all unverified runs might very well take several minutes.
If a paginated request does crash for some reason, the wrapper will abort and return all the data it has gotten so far.

### Resources that aren't embedded

This can happen for two reasons: a) the resource is impossible to embed in this scenario, or b) the resource would need a bigger recursion depth of embedding than allowed to be fully embedded.
For example, a `Category` only has a `SimpleGame` embedded. Calling `Category#full_game` will give you the full `Game` object. In fact, calling `#full_<resource>` on any object that has an un-embedded resource like that will give you that full resource.

A lot of things the API returns also come with `Link`s. For example, a `Game` has a `Link` pointing to all the `Run`s done for this game. All of these links are also available as shorthand methods. Let's get all the runs done in Super Mario 64 as an example:

```crystal
require "srcr"

game = Srcom::Api::Games.find_by_id("sm64")
runs = game.runs
```

### Rate Limits

The API is subject to [rate limits](https://github.com/speedruncomorg/api/blob/master/throttling.md). These are handled automatically by srcr. If you go over the rate limit, srcr will pause your requests until you're allowed to do them again and log a warning.

### Authentication

Most of the API is, at least for now, read-only and anonymous. For some endpoints however an API key is required, mostly when performing an action wouldn't make sense without a user context (such as using the notifications endpoint). All of the methods requiring authentication will have an `api_key` argument that takes a user's API key. If you're unsure on how to get one, read speedrun.com's documentation on [authentication](https://github.com/speedruncomorg/api/blob/master/authentication.md#aquiring-a-users-api-key).

### API Inconsistencies

The speedrun.com API has many things that are implemented in a weird, inconsistent, or undocumented way (for example, in certain contexts there can be a `Guest` with a `nil` name). Sometimes all of the three at the same time. This library tries to handle all of these as gracefully as possible. However, no guarantee can be given that every single possibly undocumented edge-case was thought of. If you encounter a `JSON::ParseError` please open an issue with the request you were trying to make, and what property couldn't be parsed.

## Contributing

1. Fork it (<https://github.com/shardlab/srcr/fork>)
2. Create your feature branch (`git checkout -b my-new-feature`)
3. Commit your changes (`git commit -am 'Add some feature'`)
4. Push to the branch (`git push origin my-new-feature`)
5. Create a new Pull Request

## Contributors

-   [badBlackShark](https://github.com/badBlackShark) - creator and maintainer

instance_methods.name: request
instance_methods.doc:
Makes a request to the given *url* using the given *method* with the given *headers* and *body*,
getting all pages of a paginated resource if *all_pages* is set to true.

NOTE: *endpoint* is just used for logging purposes.

NOTE: It is not recommended to use this method directly.
instance_methods.summary: Makes a request to the given url using the given method with the given headers and body, getting all pages of a paginated resource if all_pages is set to true.
instance_methods.args_string: (endpoint : String, url : String, method : String, headers : HTTP::Headers = HTTP::Headers.new, body : String? = nil, all_pages : Bool = true)
instance_methods.args_html: (endpoint : String, url : String, method : String, headers : HTTP::Headers = HTTP::Headers.new, body : String? = nil, all_pages : Bool = true)

def.name: request
def.body:
headers["User-Agent"] = USER_AGENT
@@rate_limiter.check_rate_limit(endpoint)
Log.info do
  "[HTTP OUT] #{method} #{endpoint} (#{body.try(&.size) || 0} bytes)"
end
Log.debug do
  "[HTTP OUT] BODY: #{body}"
end
response = HTTP::Client.exec(method: method, url: url, headers: headers, body: body)
Log.info do
  "[HTTP IN] #{response.status_code} #{response.status_message} (#{response.body.size} bytes)"
end
Log.debug do
  "[HTTP IN] BODY: #{response.body}"
end
if response.success?
  json = JSON.parse(response.body)
  data = json["data"].as_a
  if all_pages
    page = 2
    begin
      while (json["pagination"]? && (!json["pagination"]["links"].as_a.empty?)) && (json["pagination"]["links"].as_a[-1]["rel"].as_s == "next")
        @@rate_limiter.check_rate_limit(endpoint)
        Log.info do
          "[HTTP OUT] #{method} #{endpoint} (#{body.try(&.size) || 0} bytes) (page #{page})"
        end
        Log.debug do
          "[HTTP OUT] BODY: #{body}"
        end
        url = json["pagination"]["links"].as_a[-1]["uri"].as_s
        response = HTTP::Client.exec(method: method, url: url, headers: headers, body: body)
        Log.info do
          "[HTTP IN] #{response.status_code} #{response.status_message} (#{response.body.size} bytes)"
        end
        Log.debug do
          "[HTTP IN] BODY: #{response.body}"
        end
        if response.success?
          json = JSON.parse(response.body)
          data = data + json["data"].as_a
          page = page + 1
          if page == 79
            raise(Socket::ConnectError.new)
          end
        else
          if response.status_code == 420
            @@rate_limiter.global_rate_limit_exceeded
          else
            if response.content_type == "application/json"
            else
              raise(StatusException.new(response))
            end
            begin
              error = APIError.from_json(response.body)
            rescue
              raise(StatusException.new(response))
            end
            raise(CodeException.new(response, error))
          end
        end
      end
    rescue e : StatusException
      Log.error do
        e.message
      end
      Log.error do
        "Paginated request to #{endpoint} returned with #{e.status_code}. Returning incomplete data."
      end
      return data
    rescue e : Socket::ConnectError
      Log.error do
        "Paginated request to #{endpoint} timed out. Returning incomplete data."
      end
      return data
    end
    return data
  else
    return data
  end
else
  if response.status_code == 302
    request(endpoint, "https://www.speedrun.com#{response.headers["Location"]}", method, headers, body, all_pages)
  else
    if response.status_code == 420
      @@rate_limiter.global_rate_limit_exceeded
      request(endpoint, url, method, headers, body, all_pages)
    else
      if response.content_type == "application/json"
      else
        raise(StatusException.new(response))
      end
      begin
        error = APIError.from_json(response.body)
      rescue
        raise(StatusException.new(response))
      end
      raise(CodeException.new(response, error))
    end
  end
end

instance_methods.name: request_single_item
instance_methods.doc:
Makes a request to the given *url* using the given *method* with the given *headers* and *body*,
with the difference to `.request` being that only a single item is returned from the API, which is
formatted slightly different by speedrun.com.

NOTE: *endpoint* is just used for logging purposes.

NOTE: It is not recommended to use this method directly.
instance_methods.summary: Makes a request to the given url using the given method with the given headers and body, with the difference to .request being that only a single item is returned from the API, which is formatted slightly different by speedrun.com.
instance_methods.args_string: (endpoint : String, url : String, method : String, headers : HTTP::Headers = HTTP::Headers.new, body : String? = nil)
instance_methods.args_html: (endpoint : String, url : String, method : String, headers : HTTP::Headers = HTTP::Headers.new, body : String? = nil)

def.name: request_single_item
def.body:
headers["User-Agent"] = USER_AGENT
@@rate_limiter.check_rate_limit(endpoint)
Log.info do
  "[HTTP OUT] #{method} #{endpoint} (#{body.try(&.size) || 0} bytes)"
end
Log.debug do
  "[HTTP OUT] BODY: #{body}"
end
response = HTTP::Client.exec(method: method, url: url, headers: headers, body: body)
Log.info do
  "[HTTP IN] #{response.status_code} #{response.status_message} (#{response.body.size} bytes)"
end
Log.debug do
  "[HTTP IN] BODY: #{response.body}"
end
if response.success?
  json = JSON.parse(response.body)
  return json["data"]
else
  if response.status_code == 302
    request_single_item(endpoint, "https://www.speedrun.com#{response.headers["Location"]}", method, headers, body)
  else
    if response.content_type == "application/json"
    else
      raise(StatusException.new(response))
    end
    begin
      error = APIError.from_json(response.body)
    rescue
      raise(StatusException.new(response))
    end
    raise(CodeException.new(response, error))
  end
end

class_methods.name: get_records
class_methods.doc:
Gets the `Leaderboard` with the *top* N runs for the `Category` with the given *id*,
skipping over empty `Leaderboard`s if *skip_empty* is `true`.

NOTE: This can result in more than N runs per `Leaderboard`, as ties can occur.
NOTE: For full game categories, this returns an Array with only one element. For individual level
categories a `Leaderboard` is returned for each level for which this category is applicable.
class_methods.summary: Gets the Leaderboard with the top N runs for the Category with the given id, skipping over empty Leaderboards if skip_empty is true.
class_methods.args_string: (id : String, top : Int32 = 3, skip_empty : Bool = false, all_pages : Bool = true, max_results_per_page : Int32 = 200) : Array(Leaderboard)
class_methods.args_html: (id : String, top : Int32 = 3, skip_empty : Bool = false, all_pages : Bool = true, max_results_per_page : Int32 = 200) : Array(Leaderboard)

def.name: get_records
def.body:
if max_results_per_page > 200
  max_results_per_page = 200
  Log.warn do
    "[/categories/#{id}/records] Only up to 200 results per page are supported. Request adjusted."
  end
end
options = Hash(String, String).new
options["top"] = top.to_s
options["skip-empty"] = skip_empty.to_s
options["max"] = max_results_per_page
return (request_category_records(id, options, all_pages)).map do |raw|
  Leaderboard.from_json(raw.to_json)
end

class_methods.name: get_variables
class_methods.doc:
Gets all `Variable`s applicable to the `Category` specified by its *id*.

Possible values for *order_by*: "name", "mandatory", "pos", or "user-defined", with "pos" being the default.

Possbile values for *sort_direction*: "desc" or "asc", with "asc" being the default.
class_methods.summary: Gets all Variables applicable to the Category specified by its id.
class_methods.args_string: (id : String, order_by : String? = nil, sort_direction : String? = nil) : Array(Variable)
class_methods.args_html: (id : String, order_by : String? = nil, sort_direction : String? = nil) : Array(Variable)

def.name: get_variables
def.body:
id = URI.encode(id)
options = Hash(String, String).new
order = case order_by
when Nil
when "name", "mandatory", "pos"
  order_by
when "user_defined", "user-defined", "userdefined"
  "user-defined"
else
  Log.warn do
    "[/categories/<id>/variables] Unsupported sorting option \"#{order_by}\". Valid options are \"name\", \"mandatory\", \"user-defined\", and \"pos\". Defaulting to \"pos\"."
  end
  "pos"
end
if order
  options["orderby"] = order
  if sort_direction == "desc"
    options["direction"] = "desc"
  else
    options["direction"] = "asc"
  end
end
return (request_category_variables(id, options)).map do |variable|
  Variable.from_json(variable.to_json)
end

class_methods.name: find_by
class_methods.doc:
Searches through all `Game`s using the given query parameters.

Searching by *name* performs a fuzzy search across game names and abbreviations.

Seaching by *abbreviation* performs an exact-match search.

Searching by *released* restricts to search to games released in that exact year.

All other search parameters must be an ID.

Possible values for *order_by*: "name.jap", "name.int", "abbreviation", "released", or "created", with the default being "name.int".

Possible values for *sort_direction*: "desc" or "asc", with the default being "asc".

NOTE: Not specifying any filter probably leads to the request eventually crashing, leading to incomplete data.
If you need every game and can afford to lose some data per game, consider using `.find_by_bulk` instead.

NOTE: Since `Game`s are very large objects this method defaults to very low results per page
to give the request a reasonable speed.
class_methods.summary: Searches through all Games using the given query parameters.
class_methods.args_string: (name : String? = nil, abbreviation : String? = nil, released : Int32? = nil, gametype : String? = nil, platform : String? = nil, region : String? = nil, genre : String? = nil, engine : String? = nil, developer : String? = nil, publisher : String? = nil, moderator : String? = nil, all_pages : Bool = false, order_by : String? = nil, sort_direction : String? = nil, max_results_per_page : Int32 = 20) : Array(Game)
class_methods.args_html: (name : String? = nil, abbreviation : String? = nil, released : Int32? = nil, gametype : String? = nil, platform : String? = nil, region : String? = nil, genre : String? = nil, engine : String? = nil, developer : String? = nil, publisher : String? = nil, moderator : String? = nil, all_pages : Bool = false, order_by : String? = nil, sort_direction : String? = nil, max_results_per_page : Int32 = 20) : Array(Game)

def.name: find_by
def.body:
options = Hash(String, String).new
if name
  options["name"] = name
end
if abbreviation
  options["abbreviation"] = abbreviation
end
if released
  options["released"] = released.to_s
end
if gametype
  options["gametype"] = gametype
end
if platform
  options["platform"] = platform
end
if region
  options["region"] = region
end
if genre
  options["genre"] = genre
end
if engine
  options["engine"] = engine
end
if developer
  options["developer"] = developer
end
if publisher
  options["publisher"] = publisher
end
if moderator
  options["moderator"] = moderator
end
order = case order_by
when Nil
when "name_jap", "namejap", "name-jap", "name.jap"
  "name.jap"
when "name_int", "nameint", "name-int", "name.int"
  "name.int"
when "abbreviation", "released", "created"
  order_by
else
  Log.warn do
    "[/games] Unsupported sorting option \"#{order_by}\". Valid options are \"name.int\", \"name.jap\", \"abbreviation\", \"released\", and \"created\". Defaulting to \"name.int\"."
  end
  "name.int"
end
if order
  options["orderby"] = order
  if sort_direction == "desc"
    options["direction"] = "desc"
  else
    options["direction"] = "asc"
  end
end
if max_results_per_page > 200
  max_results_per_page = 200
  Log.warn do
    "[/games] Only up to 200 results per page in non bulk request are supported. Request adjusted."
  end
end
options["max"] = max_results_per_page.to_s
return (request_games(options, all_pages)).map do |raw|
  Game.from_json(raw.to_json)
end

class_methods.name: find_by_bulk
class_methods.doc:
Searches through all `Game`s using the given query parameters, returning `BulkGame`s,
which have a greatly reduced amount of data present.

Searching by *name* performs a fuzzy search across game names and abbreviations.

Seaching by *abbreviation* performs an exact-match search.

Searching by *released* restricts to search to games released in that exact year.

All other search parameters must be an ID.

Possible values for *order_by*: "name.jap", "name.int", "abbreviation", "released", or "created", with the default being "name.int".

Possible values for *sort_direction*: "desc" or "asc", with the default being "asc".

NOTE: As opposed to `.find_by` it is very much feasible to get every game on speedrun.com
with this method.
class_methods.summary: Searches through all Games using the given query parameters, returning BulkGames, which have a greatly reduced amount of data present.
class_methods.args_string: (name : String? = nil, abbreviation : String? = nil, released : Int32? = nil, gametype : String? = nil, platform : String? = nil, region : String? = nil, genre : String? = nil, engine : String? = nil, developer : String? = nil, publisher : String? = nil, moderator : String? = nil, all_pages : Bool = true, order_by : String? = nil, sort_direction : String? = nil, max_results_per_page : Int32 = 1000) : Array(BulkGame)
class_methods.args_html: (name : String? = nil, abbreviation : String? = nil, released : Int32? = nil, gametype : String? = nil, platform : String? = nil, region : String? = nil, genre : String? = nil, engine : String? = nil, developer : String? = nil, publisher : String? = nil, moderator : String? = nil, all_pages : Bool = true, order_by : String? = nil, sort_direction : String? = nil, max_results_per_page : Int32 = 1000) : Array(BulkGame)

def.name: find_by_bulk
def.body:
options = Hash(String, String).new
if name
  options["name"] = name
end
if abbreviation
  options["abbreviation"] = abbreviation
end
if released
  options["released"] = released.to_s
end
if gametype
  options["gametype"] = gametype
end
if platform
  options["platform"] = platform
end
if region
  options["region"] = region
end
if genre
  options["genre"] = genre
end
if engine
  options["engine"] = engine
end
if developer
  options["developer"] = developer
end
if publisher
  options["publisher"] = publisher
end
if moderator
  options["moderator"] = moderator
end
order = case order_by
when Nil
when "name_jap", "namejap", "name-jap", "name.jap"
  "name.jap"
when "name_int", "nameint", "name-int", "name.int"
  "name.int"
when "abbreviation", "released", "created"
  order_by
else
  Log.warn do
    "[/games?_bulk=true] Unsupported sorting option \"#{order_by}\". Valid options are \"name.int\", \"name.jap\", \"abbreviation\", \"released\", and \"created\". Defaulting to \"name.int\"."
  end
  "name.int"
end
if order
  options["orderby"] = order
  if sort_direction == "desc"
    options["direction"] = "desc"
  else
    options["direction"] = "asc"
  end
end
if max_results_per_page > 1000
  max_results_per_page = 1000
  Log.warn do
    "[/games?_bulk=true] Only up to 1000 results per page in bulk request are supported. Request adjusted."
  end
end
options["max"] = max_results_per_page.to_s
return (request_games_bulk(options, all_pages)).map do |raw|
  BulkGame.from_json(raw.to_json)
end

class_methods.name: get_by_id

class_methods.args_string: (id : String) : Srcom::Game

class_methods.name: get_categories
class_methods.doc:
Gets the categories belonging to the `Game` given by its *id* or abbreviation.

Possible values for *order_by*: "name", "miscellaneous", or "pos", with the default being "pos".

Possible values for *sort_direction*: "desc" or "asc", with the default being "asc".

NOTE: If *miscellaneous* is set to `true` only miscellaneous categories will be returned.
If it is set to `false` only non-miscellaneous categories will be returned.
If it is set to `nil` both miscellaneous and non-miscellaneous categories will be returned.
class_methods.summary: Gets the categories belonging to the Game given by its id or abbreviation.
class_methods.args_string: (id : String, miscellaneous : Bool? = nil, order_by : String? = nil, sort_direction : String? = nil) : Array(Category)
class_methods.args_html: (id : String, miscellaneous : Bool? = nil, order_by : String? = nil, sort_direction : String? = nil) : Array(Category)

def.name: get_categories
def.body:
id = URI.encode(id)
options = Hash(String, String).new
if miscellaneous.nil?
else
  options["miscellaneous"] = miscellaneous.to_s
end
order = case order_by
when Nil
when "name", "miscellaneous", "pos"
  order_by
else
  Log.warn do
    "[/games/<id>/categories] Unsupported sorting option \"#{order_by}\". Valid options are \"name\", \"miscellaneous\", and \"pos\". Defaulting to \"pos\"."
  end
  "pos"
end
if order
  options["orderby"] = order
  if sort_direction == "desc"
    options["direction"] = "desc"
  else
    options["direction"] = "asc"
  end
end
return (request_game_categories(id, options)).map do |category|

class_methods.name: get_derived_games
class_methods.doc:
Searches through all the derived games of the `Game` given by its *id* or abbreviation
using the given query parameters (and gets all derived games if none of the filters are used).

Searching by *name* performs a fuzzy search across game names and abbreviations.

Seaching by *abbreviation* performs an exact-match search.

Searching by *released* restricts to search to games released in that exact year.

All other search parameters must be an ID.

Possible values for *order_by*: "name.jap", "name.int", "abbreviation", "released", or "created", with the default being "name.int".

Possible values for *sort_direction*: "desc" or "asc", with the default being "asc".

NOTE: Since `Game`s typically don't have too many derived games it is very much feasible to get
everything here, and so that is what is defaulted to.
class_methods.summary: Searches through all the derived games of the Game given by its id or abbreviation using the given query parameters (and gets all derived games if none of the filters are used).
class_methods.args_string: (id : String, name : String? = nil, abbreviation : String? = nil, released : Int32? = nil, gametype : String? = nil, platform : String? = nil, region : String? = nil, genre : String? = nil, engine : String? = nil, developer : String? = nil, publisher : String? = nil, moderator : String? = nil, all_pages : Bool = true, order_by : String? = nil, sort_direction : String? = nil, max_results_per_page : Int32 = 200) : Array(Game)
class_methods.args_html: (id : String, name : String? = nil, abbreviation : String? = nil, released : Int32? = nil, gametype : String? = nil, platform : String? = nil, region : String? = nil, genre : String? = nil, engine : String? = nil, developer : String? = nil, publisher : String? = nil, moderator : String? = nil, all_pages : Bool = true, order_by : String? = nil, sort_direction : String? = nil, max_results_per_page : Int32 = 200) : Array(Game)

def.name: get_derived_games
def.body:
options = Hash(String, String).new
if name
  options["name"] = name
end
if abbreviation
  options["abbreviation"] = abbreviation
end
if released
  options["released"] = released.to_s
end
if gametype
  options["gametype"] = gametype
end
if platform
  options["platform"] = platform
end
if region
  options["region"] = region
end
if genre
  options["genre"] = genre
end
if engine
  options["engine"] = engine
end
if developer
  options["developer"] = developer
end
if publisher
  options["publisher"] = publisher
end
if moderator
  options["moderator"] = moderator
end
order = case order_by
when Nil
when "name_jap", "namejap", "name-jap", "name.jap"
  "name.jap"
when "name_int", "nameint", "name-int", "name.int"
  "name.int"
when "abbreviation", "released", "created"
  order_by
else
  Log.warn do
    "[/games/<id>/derived-games] Unsupported sorting option \"#{order_by}\". Valid options are \"name.int\", \"name.jap\", \"abbreviation\", \"released\", and \"created\". Defaulting to \"name.int\"."
  end
  "name.int"
end
if order
  options["orderby"] = order
  if sort_direction == "desc"
    options["direction"] = "desc"
  else
    options["direction"] = "asc"
  end
end
if max_results_per_page > 200
  max_results_per_page = 200
  Log.warn do
    "[/games/#{id}/derived-games] Only up to 200 results per page are supported. Request adjusted."
  end
end
options["max"] = max_results_per_page.to_s
return (request_derived_games(id, options, all_pages)).map do |raw|
  Game.from_json(raw.to_json)
end

class_methods.name: get_records

skipping over empty `Leaderboard`s if *skip_empty* is `true`.

If *miscellaneous* is set to `false`, only `Leaderboard`s for non-miscellaneous categories will
be returned. If it is set to `true` `Leaderboard`s for both miscellaneous and non-miscellaneous
categories will be returned.

This method defaults to getting everything, as it is doubtful a single `Game` will have
truly that many `Leaderboard`s.

NOTE: This can result in more than N runs per `Leaderboard`, as ties can occur.
class_methods.summary: Gets every Leaderboard with the top N runs for the Game given by its id or abbreviation, skipping over empty Leaderboards if skip_empty is true.
class_methods.args_string: (id : String, top : Int32 = 3, scope : String? = nil, miscellaneous : Bool = true, skip_empty : Bool = false, all_pages : Bool = true, max_results_per_page : Int32 = 200) : Array(Leaderboard)

def.name: get_records
def.body:
options = Hash(String, String).new
options["top"] = top.to_s
case scope
when Nil
when "levels", "all"
  options["scope"] = scope
when "full-game", "full_game"

else
  Log.warn do
    "[/games/<id>/recrods] Unsupported scope \"#{scope}\". Valid options are \"levels\", \"all\", and \"full-game\". Defaulting to \"all\"."

  options["scope"] = "all"
end
options["miscellaneous"] = miscellaneous.to_s
options["skip-empty"] = skip_empty.to_s
if max_results_per_page > 200
  max_results_per_page = 200
  Log.warn do
    "[/games/#{id}/records] Only up to 200 results per page are supported. Request adjusted."
  end
end
options["max"] = max_results_per_page
return (request_game_records(id, options, all_pages)).map do |raw|
  Leaderboard.from_json(raw.to_json)
end

class_methods.name: get_full_game_board
class_methods.doc:
`game` and `category` can both be ids or abbreviations
Gets the full `Leaderboard` for the given *game* and the given *category*, where both *game*
and *category* can be the respective id or abbreviation, and *category* must represent
a per-game `Category`.

Setting *top* will restrict each `Leaderboard` to only contain the top N runs.

Both *platform* and *region* can be set to a `Platform` / `Region` id to restrict the `Leaderboard`
to only containing runs completed on that `Platform` / `Region`.

When *emulators* is set to `true`, only runs done on an emulator will be included in the `Leaderboard`.
If it is set to `false`, only runs not done on an emulator will be included. If it is `nil`,
both runs doneon an emulated and runs done on a real system will be included.

If *video_only* is set to `true`, only runs with video proof will be included in the `Leaderboard`.
If it is set to false, runs with and without video proof will be included.

Possible values for *timing*: "realtime", "realtime_noloads", or "ingame". This ranks the runs
on the `Leaderboard` by that respective time.

Setting *date* will result in only runs that were done before the given date being included
in the `Leaderboard`.

The *vars* hash needs to be of the format `variable_id => value_id`, which will restrict the `Leaderboard`
to only include runs that have that `Variable` set to that `Variable::Values::Value`.

NOTE: Giving a value for *timing* that the given *game* doesn't support will result in an error.
class_methods.summary: game and category can both be ids or abbreviations Gets the full Leaderboard for the given game and the given category, where both game and category can be the respective id or abbreviation, and category must represent a per-game Category.
class_methods.args_string: (game : String, category : String, top : Int32? = nil, platform : String? = nil, region : String? = nil, emulators : Bool? = nil, video_only : Bool = false, timing : String? = nil, date : Time? = nil, vars : Hash(String, String)? = nil) : Srcom::Leaderboard
class_methods.args_html: (game : String, category : String, top : Int32? = nil, platform : String? = nil, region : String? = nil, emulators : Bool? = nil, video_only : Bool = false, timing : String? = nil, date : Time? = nil, vars : Hash(String, String)? = nil) : Srcom::Leaderboard

def.name: get_full_game_board
def.body:
game = URI.encode(game)
category = URI.encode(category)
options = Hash(String, String).new
if top
  options["top"] = top.to_s
end
if platform
  options["platform"] = platform
end
if region
  options["region"] = region
end
if emulators
  options["emulators"] = emulators.to_s
end
options["video_only"] = video_only.to_s
if date
  options["date"] = @@time_format.format(date)
end
case timing
when Nil
when "realtime", "realtime_noloads", "ingame"
  options["timing"] = timing
else
  Log.warn do
    "[/leaderboards/<game>/category/<category>] Unsupported timing method #{timing} requested. Valid timing methods are \"realtime\", \"realtime_noloads\", and \"ingame\"."
  end
end
if vars
  vars.each do |key, value|
    options["var-#{key}"] = value
  end
end
return Leaderboard.from_json((request_full_game_board(game, category, options)).to_json)

user authenticated with the given *api_key*, returning the changed run if successful.

BUG: Currently using this method will always return 500 Internal Server Error for an unknown
reason. Unfortunately, since the fault lies on speedrun.com's side, this can not be fixed.

NOTE: Obviously the authenticated user must be a moderator for the game the run was submitted
to, or a global moderator.
class_methods.summary: Changes the players who played the Run with the given id to players in the name of the user authenticated with the given api_key, returning the changed run if successful.

class_methods.name: change_status
class_methods.doc:
Changes the status of the `Run` with the given *id* to the given *status*, which must either be
"verified" or "rejected", with the given *reason* if the new status should be *rejected*, in the
name of the user authenticated with the given *api_key*, returning the run if successful.

NOTE: Obviously the authenticated user must be a moderator for the game the run was submitted
to, or a global moderator.

NOTE: This method exists only to retain an exact mapping to the API's methods. It is highly
recommended to use the `.verify` and `.reject` methods instead of this!
class_methods.summary: Changes the status of the Run with the given id to the given status, which must either be "verified" or "rejected", with the given reason if the new status should be rejected, in the name of the user authenticated with the given api_key, returning the run if successful.
class_methods.args_string: (id : String, status : String, api_key : String, reason : String? = nil) : Srcom::SimpleRun
class_methods.args_html: (id : String, status : String, api_key : String, reason : String? = nil) : Srcom::SimpleRun

def.name: change_status
def.body:
id = URI.encode(id)
case status
when "verified", "verfiy"
  verfiy(id, api_key)
when "rejected", "reject"
  if reason.nil?
    raise("Can't reject run without reason!")
  end
  reject(id, reason, api_key)
else
  raise("Unknown status: #{status}.")
end

class_methods.name: find_by
class_methods.doc:
Searches through all `Run`s using the given query parameters.

Searching by *guest* requires a `Guest`'s name.

Setting *emulated* to `true` returns only runs done on an emulated system. Setting it to `false`
will return both runs that are done on an emulated and runs that done on a real system.

Possible values for *status*: "new", "verified", or "rejected".

All other search parameters must be an ID.

Possible values for *order_by*: "category", "level", "platform", "region", "emulated", "date",
"submitted", "status", "game", or "verify-date", with the default being "game".

Possible values for *sort_direction*: "desc" or "asc", with the default being "asc".

NOTE: Not specifying any filter probably leads to the request eventually crashing, leading to incomplete data.

NOTE: Since `Run`s are very large objects this method defaults to very low results per page
to give the request a reasonable speed and the best odds at the request suceeding.
class_methods.summary: Searches through all Runs using the given query parameters.
class_methods.args_string: (user : String? = nil, guest : String? = nil, examiner : String? = nil, game : String? = nil, level : String? = nil, category : String? = nil, platform : String? = nil, region : String? = nil, emulated : Bool = false, status : String? = nil, order_by : String? = nil, sort_direction : String? = nil, all_pages : Bool = false, max_results_per_page : Int32 = 20) : Array(Run)
class_methods.args_html: (user : String? = nil, guest : String? = nil, examiner : String? = nil, game : String? = nil, level : String? = nil, category : String? = nil, platform : String? = nil, region : String? = nil, emulated : Bool = false, status : String? = nil, order_by : String? = nil, sort_direction : String? = nil, all_pages : Bool = false, max_results_per_page : Int32 = 20) : Array(Run)

def.name: find_by
def.body:
options = Hash(String, String).new
if user
  options["user"] = user
end
if guest
  options["guest"] = guest
end
if examiner
  options["examiner"] = examiner
end
if game
  options["game"] = game
end
if level
  options["level"] = level
end
if category
  options["category"] = category
end
if platform
  options["platform"] = platform
end
if region
  options["region"] = region
end
if emulated
  options["emulated"] = "true"
end
case status
when Nil
when "new", "verified", "rejected"
  options["status"] = status
else
  Log.warn do
    "[/runs] Unsupported status #{status}. Valid options are: \"new\", \"verified\", or \"rejected\"."
  end
end
order = case order_by
when Nil
when "category", "level", "platform", "region", "emulated", "date", "submitted", "status", "game"
  order_by
when "verify_date", "verify-date", "verifydate"
  "verify-date"
else
  Log.warn do
    "[/runs] Unsupported sorting option \"#{order_by}\". Valid options are \"category\", \"level\", \"platform\", \"region\", \"emulated\", \"date\", \"submitted\", \"status\", \"game\", and \"verify-date\". Defaulting to \"game\"."
  end
  "game"
end
if order
  options["orderby"] = order
  if sort_direction == "desc"
    options["direction"] = "desc"
  else
    options["direction"] = "asc"
  end
end
if max_results_per_page > 200
  max_results_per_page = 200
  Log.warn do
    "[/runs] Only up to 200 results per page are supported. Request adjusted."
  end
end
options["max"] = max_results_per_page.to_s
return (request_runs(options, all_pages)).map do |raw|
  Run.from_json(raw.to_json)
end

Searches through all `Series` using the given query parameters.

Searching by *name* performs a fuzzy search across series names and abbreviations.

Seaching by *abbreviation* performs an exact-match search.

Searching by *moderator* will only return `Series` moderated by the `User` with the given id.

Possible values for *order_by*: "name.jap", "name.int", "abbreviation", or "created", with the default being "name.int".

Possible values for *sort_direction*: "desc" or "asc", with the default being "asc".

class_methods.args_string: (name : String? = nil, abbreviation : String? = nil, moderator : String? = nil, order_by : String? = nil, sort_direction : String? = nil, all_pages : Bool = false, max_results_per_page : Int32 = 20) : Array(Srcom::Series)
class_methods.args_html: (name : String? = nil, abbreviation : String? = nil, moderator : String? = nil, order_by : String? = nil, sort_direction : String? = nil, all_pages : Bool = false, max_results_per_page : Int32 = 20) : Array(Srcom::Series)

def.name: find_by
def.body:
options = Hash(String, String).new
if name
  options["name"] = URI.encode(name)
end
if abbreviation
  options["abbreviation"] = URI.encode(abbreviation)
end
if moderator
  options["moderator"] = URI.encode(moderator)
end
order = case order_by
when "name_jap", "namejap", "name-jap", "name.jap"
  "name.jap"
when "name_int", "nameint", "name-int", "name.int"
  "name.int"
when "abbreviation", "created"
  order_by
else
  Log.warn do
    "[/series] Unsupported sorting option \"#{order_by}\". Valid options are \"name.int\", \"name.jap\", \"abbreviation\", and \"created\". Defaulting to \"name.int\"."
  end
  "name.int"
end
if order
  options["orderby"] = order
  if sort_direction == "desc"
    options["direction"] = "desc"
  else
    options["direction"] = "asc"
  end
end
if max_results_per_page > 200
  max_results_per_page = 200
  Log.warn do
    "[/series] Only up to 200 results per page in non bulk request are supported. Request adjusted."
  end
end
options["max"] = max_results_per_page.to_s
(request_series(options, all_pages)).map do |raw|
  Srcom::Series.from_json(raw.to_json)
end

Searches through all `User`s using the given query parameters.

Using *lookups* performs an exact-match search across all user names, URLs and social profiles.

Searching by *name* searches for the substring across user names and URLs.

All other parameters search across users' names on the respective platform.

Possible values for *order_by*: "name.jap", "name.int", "signup", or "role", with the default being "name.int".

Possible values for *sort_direction*: "desc" or "asc", with the default being "asc".

BUG: Not specifying any filters will currently cause the request to always fail, as simply
searching across users is disabled on speedrun.com's side.

NOTE: When using *lookup* all other filters are disabled.

NOTE: All search parameters are case-insensitive.
class_methods.summary: Searches through all Users using the given query parameters.
class_methods.args_string: (lookup : String? = nil, name : String? = nil, twitch : String? = nil, hitbox : String? = nil, twitter : String? = nil, speedrunslive : String? = nil, order_by : String? = nil, sort_direction : String? = nil, all_pages : Bool = false, max_results_per_page : Int32 = 20) : Array(User)

options = Hash(String, String).new
if lookup && ((((name || twitch) || hitbox) || twitter) || speedrunslive)
  Log.warn do
    "[/users] When `lookup` is used all other search parameters are disabled."
  end
end
if lookup
  options["lookup"] = URI.encode(lookup)
end
if name
  options["name"] = URI.encode(name)
end
if twitch
  options["twitch"] = URI.encode(twitch)
end
if hitbox
  options["hitbox"] = URI.encode(hitbox)
end
if twitter
  options["twitter"] = URI.encode(twitter)
end
if speedrunslive
  options["speedrunslive"] = URI.encode(speedrunslive)
end
order = case order_by
when Nil
when "name_jap", "namejap", "name-jap", "name.jap"
  "name.jap"
when "name_int", "nameint", "name-int", "name.int"
  "name.int"
when "signup", "role"
  order_by
else
  Log.warn do
    "[/users] Unsupported sorting option \"#{order_by}\". Valid options are \"name.int\", \"name.jap\", \"signup\", and \"role\". Defaulting to \"name.int\"."
  end
  "name.int"
end
if order
  options["orderby"] = order
  if sort_direction == "desc"
    options["direction"] = "desc"
  else
    options["direction"] = "asc"
  end
end
if max_results_per_page > 200
  max_results_per_page = 200
  Log.warn do
    "[/users] Only up to 200 results per page are supported. Request adjusted."
  end
end
options["max"] = max_results_per_page.to_s
return (request_users(options, all_pages)).map do |raw|
  User.from_json(raw.to_json)
end

types.name: CodeException
types.doc:
This exception is raised in `Api#request` and `Api#request_single_item` when a request fails with
an API error response that has a descriptive message and support links.
types.summary: This exception is raised in Api#request and Api#request_single_item when a request fails with an API error response that has a descriptive message and support links.

instance_methods.name: error_message
instance_methods.doc:
The API error message that was returned by Srcom, for example "Game <id> could not be found"
or "The submitted run does not validate against the schema. See the `errors` attached.".
instance_methods.summary: The API error message that was returned by Srcom, for example "Game <id> could not be found" or "The submitted run does not validate against the schema.

def.name: message
def.body:
String.build do |str|
  str << "#{@response.status_code} #{@response.status_message}: #{@error.message}\n"
  errors = @error.errors
  if errors
    str << "Errors: #{errors}\n"
  end
  str << "Get support: #{@error.support_link}\n"
  str << "Report an issue with the API: #{@error.issues_link}"
end

def.name: to_s
def.body:
((((io << @response.status_code) << " ") << @response.status_message) << ": ") << @error.message
if @error.errors
  (io << "\nErrors: ") << @error.errors
end
(((io << "\nGet support: ") << @error.support_link) << "\nReport an issue with the API: ") << @error.issues_link

types.name: ISO8601Converter
types.doc: speedrun.com uses ISO 8601 formatted durations for their `Run`s. This converts them to a Time::Span.
types.summary: speedrun.com uses ISO 8601 formatted durations for their Runs.

class_methods.name: from_json
class_methods.args_string: (pull : JSON::PullParser) : Time::Span

def.name: from_json
def.body:
string = pull.read_string
_sign, years, months, weeks, days, hours, minutes, seconds = (string.match(@@regex)).not_nil!.captures
years = years.try(&.to_f) || 0.0
months = months.try(&.to_f) || 0.0
weeks = weeks.try(&.to_f) || 0.0
days = days.try(&.to_f) || 0.0
hours = hours.try(&.to_f) || 0.0
minutes = minutes.try(&.to_f) || 0.0
seconds = seconds.try(&.to_f) || 0.0
days = days + (years * 365)
days = days + (months * 30)
return (((weeks.weeks + days.days) + hours.hours) + minutes.minutes) + seconds.seconds

types.name: RateLimiter
types.doc:
This keeps track of the requests being made the speedrun.com API, making sure that the rate limit
isn't exceeded.
To account for slight inaccuracies an additional `#backoff_time` (which defaults to 1 second) can
be specified. This is added to the time that is needed at minimum to be allowed another request.
types.summary: This keeps track of the requests being made the speedrun.com API, making sure that the rate limit isn't exceeded.

constructors.name: new
constructors.doc: Makes a new `RateLimiter` with the given *backoff_time* in seconds.
constructors.summary: Makes a new RateLimiter with the given backoff_time in seconds.

instance_methods.name: check_rate_limit
instance_methods.doc:
Ensures the rate limit is not currently being hit.

NOTE: *endpoint* is purely for logging purposes.
instance_methods.summary: Ensures the rate limit is not currently being hit.

def.name: check_rate_limit

instance_methods.name: global_rate_limit_exceeded
instance_methods.doc:
Waits until the oldest request occurred 60 seconds ago + twice the usual backoff time.

NOTE: This only gets called if this `RateLimiter` fails, the rate limit gets exceeded, and
speedrun.com returns error code 420.
instance_methods.summary: Waits until the oldest request occurred 60 seconds ago + twice the usual backoff time.

def.name: global_rate_limit_exceeded
def.body:
@mutex.synchronize do
  sleep_time = (60.seconds - (Time.utc - @entries[@head])) + (@backoff_time.seconds * 2)
  Log.warn do
    "Rate limit exceeded! Pausing requests for #{sleep_time.total_seconds} seconds!"
  end
  sleep(sleep_time)
end

constructors.doc:
Creates a run submission with the given properties (mind the notes below!).

Valid keys for the *times* hash are: "realtime", "realtime_noloads", or "ingame"

*date* refers to the date the run was played on. If not provided the current date will be
assumed to be the date the run was played on.

*region* and *platform* must be IDs.

Valid values for *splitsio* are a splitsio ID (such as "7h47") or a link to a link to the splits
on splits.io, such as "https://splits.io/7h47".

NOTE: Unless the user submitting is a moderator of the game the run is being submitted to
(or a global moderator) the fields `#players` and `#verified` must not be set! If *players* is
not provided, the user authenticated for the run submission will be assumed to be the only
player of the run.

NOTE: At least one of the timing methods specified in *times* must be one of the timing
methods supported by the game the run is being submit to.
constructors.summary: Creates a run submission with the given properties (mind the notes below!).
constructors.args_string: (category : String, times : Hash(String, Float64 | Time::Span), level : String? = nil, date : Time? = nil, region : String? = nil, platform : String? = nil, verified : Bool = false, players : Array(Submission::Player)? = nil, emulated : Bool = false, video : String? = nil, comment : String? = nil, splitsio : String? = nil, variables : Hash(String, Submission::Variable)? = nil)
constructors.args_html: (category : String, times : Hash(String, Float64 | Time::Span), level : String? = nil, date : Time? = nil, region : String? = nil, platform : String? = nil, verified : Bool = false, players : Array(Submission::Player)? = nil, emulated : Bool = false, video : String? = nil, comment : String? = nil, splitsio : String? = nil, variables : Hash(String, Submission::Variable)? = nil)

def.name: new
def.body:
_ = allocate
_.initialize(category, times, level, date, region, platform, verified, players, emulated, video, comment, splitsio, variables)
if _.responds_to?(:finalize)
  ::GC.add_finalizer(_)
end
_

instance_methods.summary: Returns the Game this Game is derived from, if it is a derived game.

def.name: base_game
def.body:
if (link = @links.find do |l|
  l.rel == "base-game"
end)
  id = link.uri[((link.uri.rindex("/")).not_nil! + 1)..-1]
  return Srcom::Api::Games.find_by_id(id)
else
  return nil
end

instance_methods.name: records
instance_methods.doc:
Gets every `Leaderboard` with the *top* N runs for this `Game`, skipping over empty
`Leaderboard`s if *skip_empty* is `true`.

If *miscellaneous* is set to `false`, only `Leaderboard`s for non-miscellaneous categories will
be returned. If it is set to `true` `Leaderboard`s for both miscellaneous and non-miscellaneous
categories will be returned.

This method defaults to getting everything, as it is doubtful a single `Game` will have
truly that many `Leaderboard`s.

NOTE: This can result in more than N runs per `Leaderboard`, as ties can occur.
instance_methods.summary: Gets every Leaderboard with the top N runs for this Game, skipping over empty Leaderboards if skip_empty is true.
instance_methods.args_string: (top : Int32 = 3, scope : String = "all", miscellaneous : Bool = true, skip_empty : Bool = false, all_pages : Bool = true, max_results_per_page : Int32 = 200) : Array(Leaderboard)

instance_methods.name: full_players
instance_methods.doc:
Gets all the players that played this run as either a full `User` or `Guest` object.

NOTE: Since there's a bug with `Guest`s sometimes not having a name, those entries will be
skipped.
instance_methods.summary: Gets all the players that played this run as either a full User or Guest object.

def.name: full_players
def.body:
players = Array(User | Guest).new
@players.each do |player|
  if player.rel == "user"
    players << (Srcom::Api::Users.find_by_id(player.id.not_nil!))
  else
    if player.name
      players << (Srcom::Api::Guests.find_by_name(player.name))
    end
  end
end
return players
